I think the ClassPath sould be:
  
    SET JUNIT_HOME=c:\junit3.8.1
  SET CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;%JUNIT_HOME%\junit.jar
  
  to check the ClassPath, use:
  ECHO %CLASSPATH%
  
  Regards
  
  
bramsand <don.hamilton@...> wrote:          Hi,
  
  I'm using Win98SE (which might be connected with my problem)
  
  my classpath settings;
  
  SET JUNIT_HOME=c;\junit3.8.1
  SET CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;%JUNIT_HOME%/junit.jar
  
  with this setting WhichJUnit finds all required files, but I cannot 
  run AllTests.
  
  But when adding SET CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;%JUNIT_HOME%
  
  WhichJUnit finnds everything and I can run AllTests in each output 
  mode. 
  
  However when attempting to compile a file (such as AllTests.java)javac
  cannot find junit.jar (reports 'package junit.framework does not exist').
  
  Have tried various alternative classpath settings but without success.
  
  Any hints as to where I'm going wrong?
